means: 专心致志于，埋头于，沉溺于
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 伯里住所名称，或地貌名称，来源于古英语，含义是“设防的地方”(fortified place)

sentence.Network_en: When we feel anger, we bury the emotion and feel guilty instead.
sentence.Network_cn: 当我们感到愤怒时，压抑这种情绪反而会觉得内疚。

sentence.Network_en: His reaction was to withdraw, to bury himself in work.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的反应是抽身而退，埋头于工作。

sentence.Network_en: It is time to bury our past misunderstandings.
sentence.Network_cn: 是我们捐弃前嫌的时候了。

phrase.cizu_name: bury one's head in the sand

jx.jx_cn_mean: 不正视现实；逃避现实；不愿正视困难，实行鸵鸟政策

jx.jx_en_mean: To stop fighting; resolve a quarrel.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 媾和，言归于好：停止战争；解决争端

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English  byrgan, of West Germanic origin; related to the verb borrowand to borough

entry.def: To bury something means to put it into a hole in the ground and cover it up with earth.

example.ex: They make the charcoal by burying wood in the ground and then slowly burning it.
example.tran: 他们通过把木材埋到地下缓慢燃烧来获取木炭。
掩埋坚果和种子的松鼠

entry.def: To bury a dead person means to put their body into a grave and cover it with earth.

example.ex: ...soldiers who helped to bury the dead in large communal graves...
example.tran: 帮忙把死者安葬在大型公共墓地的士兵们

example.ex: I was horrified that people would think I was dead and bury me alive...
example.tran: 想到人们会认为我死了并把我活埋，我觉得恐惧万分。

entry.def: If someone says they have buried one of their relatives, they mean that one of their relatives has died.

example.ex: He had buried his wife some two years before he retired.
example.tran: 大概在他退休前两年，他妻子去世了。

entry.def: If you bury something under a large quantity of things, you put it there, often in order to hide it.

example.ex: She buried it under some leaves...
example.tran: 她把它藏在一堆树叶下面。

example.ex: I was looking for my handbag, which was buried under a pile of old newspapers.
example.tran: 我正在找我那被埋在一堆旧报纸下面的手提包。

entry.def: If something buries a place or person, it falls on top of them so that it completely covers them and often harms them in some way.

example.ex: Latest reports say that mud slides buried entire villages...
example.tran: 最新报道说泥石流掩埋了整个整个的村庄。

example.ex: Their house was buried by a landslide...
example.tran: 他们的房子在一次塌方中被掩埋。

entry.tran: （因不高兴而）把（头或脸）贴（或靠）在…
entry.def: If you bury your head or face in something, you press your head or face against it, often because you are unhappy.

example.ex: She buried her face in the pillows ...
He held her closely, burying his head against her shoulder.
example.tran: 他紧紧地抱住她，把头靠在她的肩上。

entry.def: If something buries itself somewhere, or if you bury it there, it is pushed very deeply in there.

example.ex: The missile buried itself deep in the grassy hillside...
example.tran: 导弹深深地埋在杂草丛生的山坡上。

example.ex: He stood on the sidewalk with his hands buried in the pockets of his dark overcoat.
example.tran: 他站在人行道上，双手插在黑色外套的口袋里。

entry.def: If you bury a feeling, you try not to show it. If you bury a memory, you try to forget it.

example.ex: When we feel anger, we bury the emotion and feel guilty instead...
example.tran: 当我们感到愤怒时，压抑这种情绪反而会觉得内疚。

example.ex: It is time to bury our past misunderstandings.
example.tran: 是我们捐弃前嫌的时候了。

entry.def: If you bury yourself in a place or in an activity such as your work, you spend all your time in that place or doing that activity, usually because you want to forget about things.

example.ex: His reaction was to withdraw, to bury himself in work.
example.tran: 他的反应是抽身而退，埋头于工作。

example.ex: ...the popular image of writers burying themselves in the country in order to write.
example.tran: 常见的退隐乡间写作的作家形象

entry.def: If you bury your head in something such as a book or newspaper, or bury yourself in it, you look at it closely and concentrate very hard on it.

example.ex: My father buried his head in his newspaper...
example.tran: 我父亲专心致志地看他的报纸。

example.ex: He buried himself in his detective story again.
example.tran: 他又沉浸在他的侦探故事里了。

means.word_mean: 2. place in a grave or tomb;

sentences.sentence: "Stalin was buried behind the Kremlin wall on Red Square"
"The pharaos were entombed in the pyramids"
"My grandfather was laid to rest last Sunday"

means.word_mean: 3. place in the earth and cover with soil;
4. enclose or envelop completely, as if by swallowing;

sentences.sentence: "The huge waves swallowed the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter"
"She sank her fingers into the soft sand"
"He buried his head in her lap"

means.word_mean: 6. dismiss from the mind; stop remembering;

sentences.sentence: "i tried to bury these unpleasant memories"

list.explanation: (黑社会用语)把…关在牢里活活等死(尤指单独监禁)，判…无期徒刑

example.en: He had been buried but sentence had not yet been passed.
example.zh: 他已被单独监禁，不过尚未宣判。

auth_sentence.content: They giggled as the attendant began to bury them.
auth_sentence.res_content: They giggled as the attendant began to bury them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They giggled as the attendant began to bury them.

auth_sentence.content: Residents paid a rabbi to bury damaged ritual objects.
auth_sentence.res_content: Residents paid a rabbi to bury damaged ritual objects.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Residents paid a rabbi to bury damaged ritual objects.

auth_sentence.content: I choose not to bury my head in the sand.
auth_sentence.res_content: I choose not to bury my head in the sand.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I choose not to bury my head in the sand.

Sentence.sentence: Cyrano was dead and buried for a good three centuries before the first manned rockets started to fly.

sentences.en: He felt lonely after he buried his good friend.
sentences.cn: 埋葬了好友之后, 他感到很孤独。

sentences.en: The old man is burying his money.
It's time to bury our differences and be friends again.
sentences.cn: 是我们摒弃分歧重归于好的时候了。

sentences.en: The anger which had been buried inside me rose to the surface.
sentences.cn: 埋藏在我内心的愤怒暴露了出来。

sentences.en: Her head was buried in the book she was reading.

jushi.english: One minor mistake by the right back was enough to bury the four years' efforts and aspirations of the team.
jushi.chinese: 右后卫的一次小小失误已足以使全队四年来的努力和雄心付诸东流。

jushi.english: I tore you from my heart and buried you forever.
jushi.chinese: 我把你从心中摒弃,永远忘掉。
